info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 17 at 5:30PM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CST FOR EAST CENTRAL TUSCALOOSA AND NORTH CENTRAL BIBB COUNTIES... At 530 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Abernant, or 15 miles southwest of Bessemer, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Lake View, Brookwood, Vance, Woodstock, Tannehill Ironworks State Park, Abernant, Mercedes Benz Of Alabama, North Bibb, Bucksville, East Brookwood, Green Pond, Caffee Junction and I 20 Rest Area Near Tuscaloosa. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
